initEvents
items.text: Initialize any events on this component

items.name: initField
items.text:
Initializes this Field mixin on the current instance. Components using this mixin should call this method during
their own initialization process.

items.name: initFocusableElement
items.text: Sets up the focus listener on this Component's getFocusEl if it has one. Form Components which must implicitly participate in tabbing order usually have a naturally focusable element as their getFocusEl, and it is the DOM event of that receiving focus which drives the Component's onFocus handling, and the DOM event of it being blurred which drives the onBlur handling.

items.name: initFocusableEvents
items.text:
Template method to do any event listener initialization for a Focusable.
This generally happens after the focusEl is available.

items.name: initInheritedState
items.text: Called by getInherited to initialize the inheritedState the first time it is requested.

items.name: initLabelable
items.text:
Performs initialization of this mixin. Component classes using this mixin should call this method during their
own initialization.

items.name: initPadding
items.text:
Initializes padding by applying it to the target element, or if the layout manages
padding ensures that the padding on the target element is "0".

items.name: initRenderData
items.text: Initialized the renderData to be used when rendering the renderTpl.
Object with keys and values that are going to be applied to the renderTpl

items.name: initRenderTpl
items.text: Initializes the renderTpl.
The renderTpl XTemplate instance.

items.name: initState
items.text: Initializes the state of the object upon construction.

items.name: initStyles
items.text:
Applies padding, margin, border, top, left, height, and width configs to the
appropriate elements.

items.name: initValue
items.text: Initializes the field's value based on the initial config.

items.name: invalidateInheritedState
items.text: This method marks the current inherited state as invalid. The next time a call is made to getInherited the objects will be recreated and initialized.

items.name: is
items.text: Tests whether this Component matches a Ext.ComponentQuery selector string.

items.name: selector
items.text: The selector string to test against.
`true` if this Component matches the selector.

items.name: isAncestor
items.text:
Determines whether **this Component** is an ancestor of the passed Component.
This will return `true` if the passed Component is anywhere within the subtree
beneath this Component.

items.name: possibleDescendant
items.text:
The Component to test for presence
within this Component's subtree.

items.name: isDescendantOf
items.text: Determines whether this component is the descendant of a passed component.

items.name: ancestor
items.text: A Component which may contain this Component.
`true` if the component is the descendant of the passed component, otherwise `false`.

items.name: isDirty
items.text: Returns true if the value of this Field has been changed from its originalValue. Will always return false if the field is disabled. Note that if the owning Ext.form.Basic was configured with Ext.form.Basic#trackResetOnLoad then the originalValue is updated when the values are loaded by Ext.form.Basic.Ext.form.Basic#setValues.

True if this field has been changed from its original value (and is not disabled),
false otherwise.

items.name: isDisabled
items.text: Method to determine whether this Component is currently disabled.
the disabled state of this Component.

items.name: isDraggable
items.text: Method to determine whether this Component is draggable.
the draggable state of this component.

items.name: isDroppable
items.text: Method to determine whether this Component is droppable.
the droppable state of this component.

items.name: isEqual
items.text: Returns whether two field getValue are logically equal. Field implementations may override this to provide custom comparison logic appropriate for the particular field's data type.

items.name: value1
items.text: The first value to compare

items.name: value2
items.text: The second value to compare
True if the values are equal, false if inequal.

items.name: isEqualAsString
items.text: Returns whether two values are logically equal. Similar to isEqual, however null or undefined values will be treated as empty strings.

items.name: value1
items.text: The first value to compare

items.name: value2
items.text: The second value to compare
True if the values are equal, false if inequal.

items.name: isFileUpload
items.text: Returns whether this Field is a file upload field; if it returns true, forms will use special techniques for Ext.form.Basic#submit via AJAX. See Ext.form.Basic#hasUpload for details. If this returns true, the extractFileInput method must also be implemented to return the corresponding file input element.

items.name: isFloating
items.text: Method to determine whether this Component is floating.
the floating state of this component.

items.name: isFocusable
items.text: Determine if this Focusable can receive focus at this time. Note that Containers can be non-focusable themselves while delegating focus treatment to a child Component; see Ext.container.Container for more information.

items.name: deep
items.text:
Optionally determine if the container itself
is focusable, or if container's focus is delegated to a child component
and that child is focusable.
True if component is focusable, false if not.

items.name: isHidden
items.text: Method to determine whether this Component is currently set to hidden.
the hidden state of this Component.

items.name: isLayoutChild
items.text:
Checks if this component will be contained by the passed component as part of its
layout run. If `true`, then the layout on `this` can be skipped because it will be
encompassed when the layout for `comp` runs. Typical cases where this may be be `false`
is when asking about floaters nested in containers.

items.name: comp
items.text: The potential owner.
`true` if this component is a layout child of `comp`.

items.name: isLayoutRoot
items.text: Determines whether this Component is the root of a layout. This returns `true` if this component can run its layout without assistance from or impact on its owner. If this component cannot run its layout given these restrictions, `false` is returned and its owner will be considered as the next candidate for the layout root. Setting the _isLayoutRoot property to `true` causes this method to always return `true`. This may be useful when updating a layout of a Container which shrink wraps content, and you know that it will not change size, and so can safely be the topmost participant in the layout run.

items.name: isLayoutSuspended
items.text: Returns `true` if layout is suspended for this component. This can come from direct suspension of this component's layout activity (Ext.Container#suspendLayout) or if one of this component's containers is suspended.
`true` layout of this component is suspended.

items.name: isMasked
items.text: Returns masked state for this Component.

items.name: deep
items.text: True to look up this Component's parent masked state.
True if masked, false otherwise.

items.name: isPrototypeOf
prototype
items.text:
an object to be tested against each link in the prototype chain of the
*object* argument

items.name: object
items.text: the object whose prototype chain will be searched
Returns true if object is a prototype and false if not.

items.name: isSuspended
items.text: Checks if all events, or a specific event, is suspended.

items.name: event
items.text: The name of the specific event to check
`true` if events are suspended

items.name: isSyncing
items.text: Checks if a particular binding is synchronizing the value.

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the property being bound to.
`true` if the binding is syncing.

items.name: isValid
items.text: Returns whether or not the field value is currently valid by getErrors the processRawValue of the field. **Note**: disabled fields are always treated as valid.
True if the value is valid, else false

items.name: isVisible
items.text: Returns `true` if this component is visible.

items.name: deep
items.text:
Pass `true` to interrogate the visibility status of all parent Containers to
determine whether this Component is truly visible to the user.

Generally, to determine whether a Component is hidden, the no argument form is needed. For example when creating
dynamically laid out UIs in a hidden Container before showing them.
`true` if this component is visible, `false` otherwise.

items.name: isXType
items.text: Tests whether or not this Component is of a specific xtype. This can test whether this Component is descended from the xtype (default) or whether it is directly of the xtype specified (`shallow = true`). **If using your own subclasses, be aware that a Component must register its own xtype to participate in determination of inherited xtypes.** For a list of all available xtypes, see the Ext.Component header. Example usage: @example var t = new Ext.form.field.Text(); var isText = t.isXType('textfield'); // true var isBoxSubclass = t.isXType('field'); // true, descended from Ext.form.field.Base var isBoxInstance = t.isXType('field', true); // false, not a direct Ext.form.field.Base instance

items.name: xtype
items.text: The xtype to check for this Component

items.name: shallow
items.text:
`true` to check whether this Component is directly of the specified xtype, `false` to
check whether this Component is descended from the xtype.
`true` if this component descends from the specified xtype, `false` otherwise.

items.name: lookupController
items.text:
Gets the controller that controls this view. May be a controller that belongs
to a view higher in the hierarchy.

items.name: skipThis
items.text:
`true` to not consider the controller directly attached
to this view (if it exists).
The controller. null if no controller is found.

items.text: Gets the Controller or Component that is used as the reference holder for this view.

Unlike getInheritedConfig this method defaults to `true` because it is possible that a reference property set by the owner of a component that is also a `referenceHolder` itself. In this case, the reference connects not to this component but to the parent referenceHolder.
The reference holder.

items.text: Returns the Ext.data.Session for this instance. This property may come from this instance's session or be inherited from this object's parent.

items.name: skipThis
items.text: Pass `true` to ignore a session configured on this instance and only consider an inherited session.

items.name: lookupViewModel
items.text: Returns the Ext.app.ViewModel for this instance. This property may come from this this instance's viewModel or be inherited from this object's parent.

items.name: skipThis
items.text: Pass `true` to ignore a viewModel configured on this instance and only consider an inherited view model.

items.name: makeBindableUpdater
items.text: Returns an update method for the given Config that will call publishState to ensure two-way bindings (via bind) as well as any publishes are updated. This method is cached on the `cfg` instance for re-use.
The updater function.

items.name: mask
items.text: Masks this component with a semi-opaque layer and makes the contents unavailable to clicks. See unmask.

items.name: mon
items.text: Shorthand for addManagedListener.

items.text:
Possible values are:

- `"l"` (or `"left"`)
- `"r"` (or `"right"`)
- `"t"` (or `"top"`, or `"up"`)
- `"b"` (or `"bottom"`, or `"down"`)

items.name: distance
items.text: How far to move the element in pixels

items.name: mun
items.text: Shorthand for removeManagedListener.

items.name: nextNode
items.text: Returns the next node in the Component tree in tree traversal order. Note that this is not limited to siblings, and if invoked upon a node with no matching siblings, will walk the tree to attempt to find a match. Contrast with nextSibling.

items.text: Method to manage awareness of when components are added to their respective Container, firing an #added event. References are established at add time rather than at render time. Allows addition of behavior when a Component is added to a Container. At this stage, the Component is in the parent Container's collection of child items. After calling the superclass's onAdded, the ownerCt reference will be present, and if configured with a ref, the `refOwner` will be set.

items.name: container
items.text: Container which holds the component.

items.text: The name of the event to listen for.

items.text: The scope for `fn`.

items.text: The width of this component

items.name: height
items.text: The height of this component

items.text:

items.text: Allows addition of behavior to the enable operation. After calling the superclass's onEnable, the Component will be enabled.

items.name: onFieldMutation
items.text:
Called when some event (See the checkChangeEvents property) mutates the input field.
We react to changes.

Subclasses may provide an inplementation which may perform other tasks (eg ComboBox value matching)
before calling the checkChange method.

items.name: onFocusEnter
items.text: Called when focus enters this Component's hierarchy

items.name: event
items.text: The underlying DOM event.

items.name: target
items.text: The element gaining focus.

items.name: relatedTarget
items.text: The element losing focus.

items.name: toComponent
items.text: The Component gaining focus.

items.name: fromComponent
items.text: The Component losing focus.

items.name: onFocusLeave
items.text: Called when focus exits from this Component's hierarchy

items.name: event
items.text: The underlying DOM event.

items.name: target
items.text: The element gaining focus.

items.name: relatedTarget
items.text: The element losing focus.

items.name: toComponent
items.text: The Component gaining focus.

items.name: fromComponent
items.text: The Component losing focus.

items.name: onHide
items.text:
Allows addition of behavior to the hide operation. After
calling the superclass's onHide, the Component will be hidden.

Gets passed the same parameters as #hide.

items.name: onInheritedAdd
items.text: Called when this Inheritable is added to a parent

items.name: onInheritedRemove
items.text: Called when this inheritable is removed from a parent

items.name: destroying
items.text: `true` if this item will be destroyed by it's container

items.name: onMouseDown
items.text:
Mousedown brings to front, and programmatically grabs focus
unless the mousedown was on a focusable element

items.name: onPosition
items.text:
Called after the component is moved, this method is empty by default but can be implemented by any
subclass that needs to perform custom logic after a move occurs.

items.name: x
items.text: The new x position.

items.name: y
items.text: The new y position.

items.name: onRemoved
items.text: Method to manage awareness of when components are removed from their respective Container, firing a #removed event. References are properly cleaned up after removing a component from its owning container. Allows addition of behavior when a Component is removed from its parent Container. At this stage, the Component has been removed from its parent Container's collection of child items, but has not been destroyed (It will be destroyed if the parent Container's `autoDestroy` is `true`, or if the remove call was passed a truthy second parameter). After calling the superclass's onRemoved, the ownerCt and the `refOwner` will not be present.

items.name: destroying
items.text:
Will be passed as `true` if the Container performing the remove operation will delete this
Component upon remove.

items.name: onRender
items.text:
Template method called when this Component's DOM structure is created.

At this point, this Component's (and all descendants') DOM structure *exists* but it has not
been layed out (positioned and sized).

Subclasses which override this to gain access to the structure at render time should
call the parent class's method before attempting to access any child elements of the Component.

items.name: parentNode
items.text: The parent Element in which this Component's encapsulating element is contained.

items.name: containerIdx
items.text: The index within the parent Container's child collection of this Component.

items.name: onResize
items.text: Called when the component is resized. This method is not called on components that use liquidLayout, such as Ext.button.Button and Ext.form.field.Base.

items.name: width
items.text: The new width that was set

items.name: height
items.text: The new height that was set

items.name: oldWidth
items.text: The previous width

items.name: oldHeight
items.text: The previous height

items.name: onScrollEnd
items.text: Invoked when a scroll operation is completed via this component's scrollable.

items.name: x
items.text: The current x position

items.name: y
items.text: The current y position

items.name: onScrollMove
items.text: Invoked when this component is scrolled via its scrollable.

items.name: x
items.text: The current x position

items.name: y
items.text: The current y position

items.name: onScrollStart
items.text: Invoked when a scroll is initiated on this component via its scrollable.

items.name: x
items.text: The current x position

items.name: y
items.text: The current y position

items.name: onShow
items.text:
Allows addition of behavior to the show operation. After
calling the superclass's onShow, the Component will be visible.

Override in subclasses where more complex behaviour is needed.

Gets passed the same parameters as #show.

items.name: onShowComplete
items.text: Invoked after the #afterShow method is complete. Gets passed the same `callback` and scope parameters that #afterShow received.

items.name: onStateChange
items.text: This method is called when any of the stateEvents are fired.

items.name: owns
items.text: Returns `true` if the passed element is within the container tree of this component. For example if a menu's submenu contains an Ext.form.field.Date, that top level menu owns the elements of the date picker. Using this method, you can tell if an event took place within a certain component tree.

items.name: postBlur
items.text: Template method to do any post-blur processing.

items.name: e
items.text: The event object

items.name: postFocus
items.text: Template method to do any post-focus processing.

items.name: e
items.text: The event object

items.name: previousNode
items.text: Returns the previous node in the Component tree in tree traversal order. Note that this is not limited to siblings, and if invoked upon a node with no matching siblings, will walk the tree in reverse order to attempt to find a match. Contrast with previousSibling.

items.name: selector
items.text: A Ext.ComponentQuery selector to filter the preceding nodes.
The previous node (or the previous node which matches the selector). Returns null if there is no matching node.

items.name: previousSibling
items.text: Returns the previous sibling of this Component. Optionally selects the previous sibling which matches the passed Ext.ComponentQuery selector. May also be referred to as **`prev()`** Note that this is limited to siblings, and if no siblings of the item match, null is returned. Contrast with previousNode

items.name: selector
items.text: A Ext.ComponentQuery selector to filter the preceding items.
The previous sibling (or the previous sibling which matches the selector). Returns null if there is no matching sibling.

items.name: processRawValue
items.text: Performs any necessary manipulation of a raw field value to prepare it for rawToValue and/or validate, for instance stripping out ignored characters. In the base implementation it does nothing; individual subclasses may override this as needed.

items.name: value
items.text: The unprocessed string value
The processed string value

items.name: propertyIsEnumerable
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

If the object does not have the specified property, this
method returns false.

items.name: publishState
items.text: Publish this components state to the `ViewModel`. If no arguments are given (or if this is the first call), the entire state is published. This state is determined by the publishes property. This method is called only by component authors.

items.name: property
items.text: The name of the property to update.

items.name: value
items.text: The value of `property`. Only needed if `property` is given.

items.name: publishValue
items.text: Publish the value of this field.

items.name: rawToValue
items.text: Converts a raw input field value into a mixed-type value that is suitable for this particular field type. This allows controlling the normalization and conversion of user-entered values into field-type-appropriate values, e.g. a Date object for Ext.form.field.Date, and is invoked by getValue. It is up to individual implementations to decide how to handle raw values that cannot be successfully converted to the desired object type. See valueToRaw for the opposite conversion. The base implementation does no conversion, returning the raw value untouched.
The converted value.

items.name: refreshScroll
items.text:
Implementation which updates the scroll range of a touch scroller.
Subclasses may change implementation.

items.name: registerFloatingItem
items.text: Called by Component#doAutoRender Register a Container configured `floating: true` with this Component's Ext.ZIndexManager. Components added in this way will not participate in any layout, but will be rendered upon first show in the way that Ext.window.Windows are.

items.name: relayEvents
items.text:
Relays selected events from the specified Observable as if the events were fired by `this`.

For example if you are extending Grid, you might decide to forward some events from store.
So you can do this inside your initComponent:

    this.relayEvents(this.getStore(), ['load']);

The grid instance will then have an observable 'load' event which will be passed
the parameters of the store's load event and any function fired with the grid's
load event would have access to the grid using the this keyword (unless the event
is handled by a controller's control/listen event listener in which case 'this'
will be the controller rather than the grid).

items.name: origin
items.text: The Observable whose events this object is to relay.

items.name: events
items.text:
Array of event names to relay or an Object with key/value
pairs translating to ActualEventName/NewEventName respectively. For example:
    this.relayEvents(this, {add:'push', remove:'pop'});

Would now redispatch the add event of this as a push event and the remove event as a pop event.

items.name: prefix
removeAfterListener
items.text: Alias for unAfter.

items.name: removeBeforeListener
items.text: Alias for unBefore.

items.name: removeCls
items.text: Removes a CSS class from the top level element representing this component.

items.name: cls
items.text: The CSS class name to remove.
Returns the Component to allow method chaining.

items.name: removeClsWithUI
items.text: Removes a cls to the uiCls array, which will also call removeUIClsFromElement and removes it from all elements of this component.

items.name: cls
items.text: A string or an array of strings to remove to the uiCls.

items.name: removeDelegatedListener
items.text: Removes delegated listeners for a given eventName, function, and scope. Users should not invoke this method directly. It is called automatically by the framework as part of removeListener processing.

items.name: removeListener
items.text: Removes an event handler.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The type of event the handler was associated with.

items.name: fn
items.text: The handler to remove. **This must be a reference to the function passed into the Ext.util.Observable#addListener call.**

items.name: scope
removeManagedListener
items.text: Removes listeners that were added by the mon method.

items.name: item
items.text: The item from which to remove a listener/listeners.

items.name: ename
items.text: The event name, or an object containing event name properties.

items.name: fn
items.text: (optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the handler function.

items.name: scope
items.text:
(optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the scope (`this` reference)
in which the handler function is executed.

items.name: removeManagedListenerItem
items.text: Remove a single managed listener item

items.name: isClear
items.text: True if this is being called during a clear

items.name: managedListener
items.text:
The managed listener item
See removeManagedListener for other args

items.name: removeUIClsFromElement
items.text: Method which removes a specified UI + uiCls from the components element. The cls which is added to the element will be: `this.baseCls + '-' + ui + uiCls`.

items.name: uiCls
items.text: The UI class to remove from the element.

items.name: removeUIFromElement
items.text: Method which removes a specified UI from the components element.

items.name: render
items.text: Renders the Component into the passed HTML element. **If you are using a Ext.container.Container object to house this Component, then do not use the render method.** A Container's child Components are rendered by that Container's Ext.container.Container#layout manager when the Container is first rendered. When creating complex UIs, it is important to remember that sizing and positioning of child items is the responsibility of the Container's Ext.container.Container#layout manager. If you expect child items to be sized in response to user interactions, you must configure the Container with a layout manager which creates and manages the type of layout you have in mind. **Omitting the Container's Ext.Container#layout config means that a basic layout manager is used which does nothing but render child components sequentially into the Container. No sizing or positioning will be performed in this situation.**

items.name: container
items.text:
The element this Component should be
rendered into. If it is being created from existing markup, this should be omitted.

items.name: position
items.text:
The element ID or DOM node index within the container **before**
which this component will be inserted (defaults to appending to the end of the container)

items.name: renderActiveError
items.text:
Overrides the method from the Ext.form.Labelable mixin to also add the invalidCls to the inputEl,
as that is required for proper styling in IE with nested fields (due to lack of child selector)

items.name: reset
items.text: Resets the current field value to the originally loaded value and clears any validation messages. See Ext.form.Basic.Ext.form.Basic#trackResetOnLoad

items.name: resetOriginalValue
items.text: Resets the field's originalValue property so it matches the current getValue. This is called by Ext.form.Basic.Ext.form.Basic#setValues if the form's Ext.form.Basic#trackResetOnLoad property is set to true.

items.name: resolveListenerScope
items.text: Gets the Controller or Component that is used as the event root for this view.

items.name: defaultScope
items.text: The default scope to return if none is found.
The default listener scope.

items.name: resolveSatelliteListenerScope
items.text:
Returns the default listener scope for a "satellite" of this component.
Used for resolving scope for observable objects that are not part of the normal
Container/Component hierarchy (for example, plugins)
The listener scope

items.name: resumeEvent
items.text: Resumes firing of the named event(s). After calling this method to resume events, the events will fire when requested to fire. **Note that if the suspendEvent method is called multiple times for a certain event, this converse method will have to be called the same number of times for it to resume firing.**

items.name: eventName
items.text: Multiple event names to resume.

items.name: resumeEvents
items.text: Resumes firing events (see suspendEvents). If events were suspended using the `queueSuspended` parameter, then all events fired during event suspension will be sent to any listeners now.

items.name: discardQueue
items.text: `true` to prevent any previously queued events from firing while we were suspended. See suspendEvents.

items.name: reverseTranslateXY
items.text: Converts local coordinates into page-level coordinates

items.name: xy
items.text: The local x and y coordinates
The translated coordinates

items.name: revertFocus
items.text:
Returns focus to the cached previously focused Component or element.

Usually called by onHide.

items.name: savePropsToState
items.text:
Gathers additional named properties of the instance and adds their current values
to the passed state object.

items.name: propNames
items.text: The name (or array of names) of the property to save.

items.name: state
items.text: The state object in to which to save the property values.
state

items.name: savePropToState
items.text:
Conditionally saves a single property from this object to the given state object.
The idea is to only save state which has changed from the initial state so that
current software settings do not override future software settings. Only those
values that are user-changed state should be saved.

items.name: propName
items.text: The name of the property to save.

items.name: state
items.text: The state object in to which to save the property.

items.name: stateName
items.text: (optional) The name to use for the property in state.
True if the property was saved, false if not.

items.name: saveState
items.text: Saves the state of the object to the persistence store.

items.name: scrollBy
deltaX
items.text:
Either the x delta, an Array specifying x and y deltas or
an object with "x" and "y" properties.

items.name: deltaY
items.text: Either the y delta, or an animate flag or config object.

items.name: animate
items.text: Animate flag/config object if the delta values were passed separately.

items.name: scrollTo
items.text: Scrolls this component to the specified `x` and `y` coordinates. Only applicable for scrollable components.

items.name: animate
items.text:
true for the default animation or a standard Element
animation config object

items.name: sequenceFx
items.text: Ensures that all effects queued after sequenceFx is called on this object are run in sequence. This is the opposite of syncFx.
this

items.name: setActive
items.text: This method is called internally by Ext.ZIndexManager to signal that a floating Component has either been moved to the top of its zIndex stack, or pushed from the top of its zIndex stack. If a _Window_ is superceded by another Window, deactivating it hides its shadow. This method also fires the Ext.Component#activate or Ext.Component#deactivate event depending on which action occurred.

items.name: active
items.text: True to activate the Component, false to deactivate it.

items.name: doFocus
items.text:
When activating, set to true to focus the component;
when deactivating, set to false to avoid returning focus to previous element.

items.name: setActiveError
items.text: Sets the active error message to the given string. This replaces the entire error message contents with the given string. Also see setActiveErrors which accepts an Array of messages and formats them according to the activeErrorsTpl. Note that this only updates the error message element's text and attributes, you'll have to call doComponentLayout to actually update the field's layout to match. If the field extends Ext.form.field.Base you should call Ext.form.field.Base#markInvalid instead.

items.name: msg
items.text: The error message

items.name: setActiveErrors
items.text: Set the active error message to an Array of error messages. The messages are formatted into a single message string using the activeErrorsTpl. Also see setActiveError which allows setting the entire error contents with a single string. Note that this only updates the error message element's text and attributes, you'll have to call doComponentLayout to actually update the field's layout to match. If the field extends Ext.form.field.Base you should call Ext.form.field.Base#markInvalid instead.

items.name: errors
items.text: The error messages

items.name: setAutoScroll
items.text: Sets the overflow on the content element of the component.

items.name: scroll
items.text: True to allow the Component to auto scroll.
this

items.name: border
items.text: The border, see border. If a falsey value is passed the border will be removed.

items.name: setBox
items.text: Sets the element's box.

items.name: box
items.text: The box to fill {x, y, width, height}
this

items.name: setBoxLabel
items.text: Sets the boxLabel for this checkbox.

items.name: boxLabel
items.text: The new label

items.name: setDisabled
items.text: Enable or disable the component.

items.name: disabled
items.text: `true` to disable.

items.name: setDock
items.text:
Sets the dock position of this component in its parent panel. Note that this only has effect if this item is part
of the `dockedItems` collection of a parent that has a DockLayout (note that any Panel has a DockLayout by default)

items.name: dock
items.text: The dock position.
this

items.name: setError
items.text: Set the current error state

items.name: error
items.text: The error message to set

items.name: setFieldDefaults
items.text:
Applies a set of default configuration values to this Labelable instance. For each of the properties in the given
object, check if this component hasOwnProperty that config; if not then it's inheriting a default value from its
prototype and we should apply the default value.

items.name: defaults
items.text: The defaults to apply to the object.

items.name: setFieldLabel
items.text: Set the label of this field.

items.name: label
items.text: The new label. The labelSeparator will be automatically appended to the label string.

items.name: setFieldStyle
items.text: Set the fieldStyle of the inputEl.

items.name: style
items.text: The style(s) to apply. Should be a valid argument to Ext.dom.Element#applyStyles.

items.name: setFlex
items.text:
Sets the flex property of this component. Only applicable when this component is
an item of a box layout

items.name: setHeight
items.text: Sets the height of the component. This method fires the resize event.

items.name: height
items.text: The new height to set. This may be one of: - A Number specifying the new height in pixels. - A String used to set the CSS height style. - undefined to leave the height unchanged. - null to clear the height.
this

items.name: setHidden
items.text: Sets the hidden state of this component. This is basically the same as setVisible but the boolean parameter has the opposite meaning.

items.name: setListeners
items.text: An alias for Ext.util.Observable#addListener. In versions prior to 5.1, listeners had a generated setter which could be called to add listeners. In 5.1 the listeners config is not processed using the config system and has no generated setter, so this method is provided for backward compatibility. The preferred way of adding listeners is to use the on method.

items.name: listeners
items.text: The listeners

items.name: setLoading
items.text: This method allows you to show or hide a LoadMask on top of this component. The mask will be rendered into the element returned by getMaskTarget which for most Components is the Component's element. See getMaskTarget and maskElement. Most Components will return null indicating that their LoadMask cannot reside inside their element, but must be rendered into the document body. Ext.view.Table however will direct a LoadMask to be rendered into the owning Ext.panel.Table.

items.name: load
items.text:
True to show the default LoadMask, a config object that will be passed to the
LoadMask constructor, or a message String to show. False to hide the current LoadMask.
The LoadMask instance that has just been shown.

items.name: setLocalX
items.text: Sets the local x coordinate of this element using CSS style. When used on an absolute positioned element this method is symmetrical with getLocalX, but may not be symmetrical when used on a relatively positioned element.

items.name: x
items.text: The x coordinate. A value of null sets the left style to 'auto'.
this

items.name: setLocalXY
items.text: Sets the local x and y coordinates of this element using CSS style. When used on an absolute positioned element this method is symmetrical with getLocalXY, but may not be symmetrical when used on a relatively positioned element.

items.name: x
items.text: The x coordinate or an array containing [x, y]. A value of null sets the left style to 'auto'

items.name: y
items.text: The y coordinate, required if x is not an array. A value of null sets the top style to 'auto'
this

items.name: setLocalY
items.text: Sets the local y coordinate of this element using CSS style. When used on an absolute positioned element this method is symmetrical with getLocalY, but may not be symmetrical when used on a relatively positioned element.

items.name: y
items.text: The y coordinate. A value of null sets the top style to 'auto'.
this

items.name: setMargin
items.text: Sets the margin on the target element.

items.name: margin
items.text: The margin to set. See the margin config.

items.name: setMasked
items.text: Set masked state for this Component.

items.name: isMasked
items.text: True if masked, false otherwise.

items.name: setOverflowXY
items.text: Sets the overflow x/y on the content element of the component. The x/y overflow values can be any valid CSS overflow (e.g., 'auto' or 'scroll'). By default, the value is 'hidden'. Passing undefined will preserve the current value.

items.name: overflowX
items.text: The overflow-x value.

items.name: overflowY
items.text: The overflow-y value.
this

items.name: setPagePosition
items.text: Sets the page XY position of the component. To set the left and top instead, use setPosition. This method fires the event-move event.

items.name: x
items.text: The new x position or an array of `[x,y]`.

items.name: y
items.text: The new y position.

items.name: animate
items.text:
True to animate the Component into its new position. You may also pass an
animation configuration.
this

items.name: setPosition
items.text: Sets the left and top of the component. To set the page XY position instead, use Ext.Component#setPagePosition. This method fires the event-move event.

items.name: x
items.text: The new left, an array of `[x,y]`, or animation config object containing `x` and `y` properties.

items.name: y
items.text: The new top.

items.name: animate
items.text:
If `true`, the Component is _animated_ into its new position. You may also pass an
animation configuration.
this

items.name: setRawValue
items.text: Sets the checked state of the checkbox.

items.name: value
items.text: The following values will check the checkbox: `true, 'true', '1', 1, or 'on'`, as well as a String that matches the inputValue. Any other value will un-check the checkbox.
the new checked state of the checkbox

items.name: setReadOnly
items.text: Sets the read only state of this field.

items.name: readOnly
items.text: Whether the field should be read only.

items.name: setScrollX
items.text: Sets the "x" scroll position for this component. Only applicable for scrollable components

items.name: animate
items.text:
true for the default animation or a standard Element
animation config object

items.name: setScrollY
items.text: Sets the "y" scroll position for this component. Only applicable for scrollable components

items.name: animate
items.text:
true for the default animation or a standard Element
animation config object

items.name: setSize
items.text: Sets the width and height of this Component. This method fires the resize event. This method can accept either width and height as separate arguments, or you can pass a size object like `{width:10, height:20}`.

items.name: width
items.text: The new width to set. This may be one of: - A Number specifying the new width in pixels. - A String used to set the CSS width style. - A size object in the format `{width: widthValue, height: heightValue}`. - undefined to leave the width unchanged.

items.name: height
items.text: The new height to set (not required if a size object is passed as the first arg). This may be one of: - A Number specifying the new height in pixels. - A String used to set the CSS height style. Animation may **not** be used. - undefined to leave the height unchanged.
this

items.name: setStyle
property
items.text:
The style property to be set, or an object of
multiple styles.

items.name: value
items.text:
The value to apply to the given property, or null if an
object was passed.
this

items.name: setTabIndex
items.text:
Set the tabIndex property for this Focusable. If the focusEl
is avalable, set tabIndex attribute on it, too.

items.name: newTabIndex
items.text: new tabIndex to set

items.name: setUI
items.text: Sets the UI for the component. This will remove any existing UIs on the component. It will also loop through any uiCls set on the component and rename them so they include the new UI.

items.name: ui
items.text: The new UI for the component.

items.name: setupFramingTpl
items.text:
Inject a reference to the function which applies the render template into the framing template. The framing template
wraps the content.

items.name: setValue
items.text: Sets the checked state of the checkbox, and invokes change detection.

items.name: checked
items.text: The following values will check the checkbox: `true, 'true', '1', or 'on'`, as well as a String that matches the inputValue. Any other value will un-check the checkbox. You may also pass an array of string values. If an array of strings is passed, all checkboxes in the group with a matched name will be checked. The checkbox will be unchecked if a corresponding value is not found in the array.
this

items.name: setVisible
items.text: Convenience function to hide or show this component by Boolean.

items.name: visible
items.text: `true` to show, `false` to hide.
this

items.name: setWidth
items.text: Sets the width of the component. This method fires the resize event.

items.name: width
items.text: The new width to set. This may be one of: - A Number specifying the new width in pixels. - A String used to set the CSS width style. - undefined to leave the width unchanged. - null to clear the width.
this

items.name: setX
items.text: Sets the X position of the DOM element based on page coordinates.

items.name: x
items.text: The X position
this

items.name: setXY
items.text: Sets the position of the DOM element in page coordinates.

items.name: pos
items.text:
Contains X & Y [x, y] values for new position (coordinates
are page-based)
this

items.name: setY
items.text: Sets the Y position of the DOM element based on page coordinates.

items.name: y
items.text: The Y position
this

items.name: setZIndex
items.text:
z-index is managed by the zIndexManager and may be overwritten at any time.
Returns the next z-index to be used.

If this is a Container, then it will have rebased any managed floating Components,
and so the next available z-index will be approximately 10000 above that.

items.name: show
items.text: Shows this Component, rendering it first if autoRender or cfg-floating are `true`. After being shown, a cfg-floating Component (such as a Ext.window.Window), is activated it and brought to the front of its zIndexManager.

items.name: animateTarget
items.text: **only valid for cfg-floating Components such as Ext.window.Windows or Ext.tip.ToolTips, or regular Components which have been configured with `floating: true`.** The target from which the Component should animate from while opening.

items.name: callback
items.text:
A callback function to call after the Component is displayed.
Only necessary if animation was specified.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the callback is executed.
Defaults to this Component.
this

items.name: showAt
x
items.text: The new x position or array of `[x,y]`.

items.name: y
items.text: The new y position

items.name: animate
items.text:
True to animate the Component into its new position. You may also pass an
animation configuration.
this

items.name: showBy
items.text: Shows this component by the specified Ext.Component or Ext.dom.Element. Used when this component is cfg-floating.

items.name: component
items.text: The Ext.Component or Ext.dom.Element to show the component by.

items.name: position
items.text: Alignment position as used by Ext.util.Positionable#getAlignToXY. Defaults to defaultAlign. See alignTo for possible values.

items.name: offsets
items.text: Alignment offsets as used by Ext.util.Positionable#getAlignToXY. See alignTo for possible values.
this

items.name: stopAnimation
items.text:
Stops any running effects and clears this object's internal effects queue if it contains any additional effects
that haven't started yet.
The Element

items.name: stopFx
items.text:
Stops any running effects and clears this object's internal effects queue if it contains any additional effects
that haven't started yet.
The Element

items.name: suspendEvent
items.text: Suspends firing of the named event(s). After calling this method to suspend events, the events will no longer fire when requested to fire. **Note that if this is called multiple times for a certain event, the converse method resumeEvent will have to be called the same number of times for it to resume firing.**

items.name: eventName
items.text: Multiple event names to suspend.

items.name: suspendEvents
items.text: Suspends the firing of all events. (see resumeEvents)

items.name: queueSuspended
items.text: `true` to queue up suspended events to be fired after the resumeEvents call instead of discarding all suspended events.

items.name: syncFx
items.text: Ensures that all effects queued after syncFx is called on this object are run concurrently. This is the opposite of sequenceFx.
this

items.name: syncHidden
items.text: synchronizes the hidden state of this component with the state of its hierarchy

items.name: toBack
items.text: Sends this Component to the back of (lower z-index than) any other visible windows
this

items.name: toFront
items.text: Brings this floating Component to the front of any other visible, floating Components managed by the same Ext.ZIndexManager If this Component is modal, inserts the modal mask just below this Component in the z-index stack.

items.name: preventFocus
items.text: Specify `true` to prevent the Component from being focused.
this

items.name: toggleInvalidCls
items.text: Add/remove invalid class(es)

items.name: toLocaleString
items.text: Returns a string representing the object. This method is meant to be overridden by derived objects for locale-specific purposes. Objects toLocaleString returns the result of calling toString. This function is provided to give objects a generic toLocaleString method, even though not all may use it. Currently, only Array, Number, and Date override toLocaleString.
Object represented as a string.

items.name: toString

items.text: Object represented as a string.

items.name: transformRawValue
items.text: Transform the raw value before it is set

items.name: value
items.text: The value
The value to set

items.text: Translates the passed page coordinates into left/top css values for the element

items.name: x
items.text: The page x or an array containing [x, y]

items.name: y
items.text: The page y, required if x is not an array

An object with left and top properties. e.g.
{left: (value), top: (value)}

items.name: translateXY
items.text: Translates the passed page coordinates into x and y css values for the element

items.name: x
items.text: The page x or an array containing [x, y]

items.name: y
items.text: The page y, required if x is not an array

An object with x and y properties. e.g.
{x: (value), y: (value)}

items.name: trimLabelSeparator
items.text: Returns the trimmed label by slicing off the label separator character. Can be overridden.
The trimmed field label, or empty string if not defined

items.name: un
items.text: Shorthand for removeListener.

items.name: unAfter
items.text: Removes a before-event handler. Same as removeListener with `order` set to `'after'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event the handler was associated with.

items.name: fn
items.text: The handler to remove.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope originally specified for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: Extra options object.

items.name: unBefore
items.text: Removes a before-event handler. Same as removeListener with `order` set to `'before'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event the handler was associated with.

items.name: fn
items.text: The handler to remove.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope originally specified for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: Extra options object.

items.name: unmask
items.text: Removes the mask applied by mask

items.name: unsetActiveError
items.text: Clears the active error message(s). Note that this only clears the error message element's text and attributes, you'll have to call doComponentLayout to actually update the field's layout to match. If the field extends Ext.form.field.Base you should call Ext.form.field.Base#clearInvalid instead.

items.name: up
items.text: Navigates up the ownership hierarchy searching for an ancestor Container which matches any passed selector or component. *Important.* There is not a universal upwards navigation pointer. There are several upwards relationships such as the Ext.button.Button which activates a Ext.button.Button#cfg-menu, or the Ext.menu.Item which activated a Ext.menu.Item#cfg-menu, or the Ext.grid.column.Column which activated the column menu. These differences are abstracted away by this method. Example: var owningTabPanel = grid.up('tabpanel');

items.name: selector
items.text: The selector component or actual component to test. If not passed the immediate owner/activator is returned.

items.name: limit
items.text: This may be a selector upon which to stop the upward scan, or a limit of the number of steps, or Component reference to stop on.
The matching ancestor Container (or undefined if no match was found).

items.name: update
items.text: Update the content area of a component.

items.name: htmlOrData
items.text:
If this component has been configured with a
template via the tpl config then it will use this argument as data to populate the
template. If this component was not configured with a template, the components
content area will be updated via Ext.Element update.

items.name: loadScripts
items.text: Only legitimate when using the html configuration. Causes embedded script tags to be executed. Inline source will be executed with this Component as the scope (`this` reference).

items.name: callback
items.text: Only legitimate when using the html configuration. Callback to execute when scripts have finished loading.

items.name: scriptScope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which to
execute *inline* script elements content. Scripts with a `src` attribute cannot
be executed with this scope.

items.name: updateBox
items.text: Sets the current box measurements of the component's underlying element.

items.name: box
items.text: An object in the format {x, y, width, height}
this

items.name: updateFrame
items.text: Updates the frame elements to match new framing. The current `frameBody` is preserved by transplanting it into the new frame. All other frame childEls are destroyed and recreated if needed by the new frame. This method cannot transition from framed to non-framed or vise-versa or between table and div based framing.

items.name: updateLayout
items.text: Updates this component's layout. If this update affects this components ownerCt, that component's updateLayout method will be called to perform the layout instead. Otherwise, just this component (and its child items) will layout.

items.name: options
items.text: An object with layout options.

items.name: defer
items.text: `true` if this layout should be deferred.

items.name: isRoot
items.text: `true` if this layout should be the root of the layout.

items.name: updateSession
items.text: Updates the session config.

items.name: updateViewModel
items.text: Updates the viewModel config.

items.name: validate
items.text: Returns whether or not the field value is currently valid by getErrors the field's current value, and fires the validitychange event if the field's validity has changed since the last validation. **Note**: disabled fields are always treated as valid. Custom implementations of this method are allowed to have side-effects such as triggering error message display. To validate without side-effects, use isValid.
True if the value is valid, else false

items.name: validateValue
items.text: Uses getErrors to build an array of validation errors. If any errors are found, they are passed to markInvalid and false is returned, otherwise true is returned. Previously, subclasses were invited to provide an implementation of this to process validations - from 3.2 onwards getErrors should be overridden instead.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to validate
True if all validations passed, false if one or more failed

items.name: valueOf
items.text: Returns the primitive value of the specified object. JavaScript calls the valueOf method to convert an object to a primitive value. You rarely need to invoke the valueOf method yourself; JavaScript automatically invokes it when encountering an object where a primitive value is expected. By default, the valueOf method is inherited by every object descended from Object. Every built- in core object overrides this method to return an appropriate value. If an object has no primitive value, valueOf returns the object itself, which is displayed as: [object Object] You can use valueOf within your own code to convert a built-in object into a primitive value. When you create a custom object, you can override `Object.valueOf` to call a custom method instead of the default Object method. You can create a function to be called in place of the default valueOf method. Your function must take no arguments. Suppose you have an object type `myNumberType` and you want to create a valueOf method for it. The following code assigns a user-defined function to the object's valueOf method: myNumberType.prototype.valueOf = new Function(functionText) With the preceding code in place, any time an object of type `myNumberType` is used in a context where it is to be represented as a primitive value, JavaScript automatically calls the function defined in the preceding code. An object's valueOf method is usually invoked by JavaScript, but you can invoke it yourself as follows: myNumber.valueOf() Note: Objects in string contexts convert via the toString method, which is different from String objects converting to string primitives using valueOf. All objects have a string conversion, if only `"[object type]"`. But many objects do not convert to number, boolean, or function.
Returns value of the object or the object itself.

items.name: valueToRaw
items.text: Converts a mixed-type value to a raw representation suitable for displaying in the field. This allows controlling how value objects passed to setValue are shown to the user, including localization. For instance, for a Ext.form.field.Date, this would control how a Date object passed to setValue would be converted to a String for display in the field. See rawToValue for the opposite conversion. The base implementation simply does a standard toString conversion, and converts Ext#isEmpty to an empty string.

items.name: value
items.text: The mixed-type value to convert to the raw representation.
The converted raw value.

items.name: $eventOptions
items.text: Matches options property names within a listeners specification object  - property names which are never used as event names.

items.name: _isLayoutRoot
items.text: Setting this property to `true` causes the isLayoutRoot method to return `true` and stop the search for the top-most component for a layout.

items.name: _renderState
items.text: This property holds one of the following values during the render process: * **0** - The component is not rendered. * **1** - The component has fired beforerender and is about to call beforeRender. The component has just started rendering. * **2** - The component has finished the beforeRender process and is about to call onRender. This is when `rendering` is set to `true`. * **3** - The component has started onRender. This is when rendered is set to `true`. * **4** - The component has finished its afterrender process.

items.name: ariaEl
items.text:
The name of the Component property that holds
a reference to the Element that serves as that Component's ARIA element.
This property will be replaced with the actual Element reference after rendering.

Most of the simple Components will have their main element as ariaEl.

items.name: ariaRenderAttributes
items.text:
**Instance specific** ARIA attributes
to render into Component's ariaEl. This object is only used during rendering,
and is discarded afterwards.

items.name: ariaRole
items.text:
ARIA role for this Component, defaults to no role.
With no role, no other ARIA attributes are set.

items.name: autoGenId
items.text: `true` indicates an id was auto-generated rather than provided by configuration.

items.name: beforeReset
items.text: Template method before a field is reset.

items.name: bodyEl
items.text: The div Element wrapping the component's contents. Only available after the component has been rendered.

items.name: boxLabelEl
items.text: A reference to the label element created for the boxLabel. Only present if the component has been rendered and has a boxLabel configured.

items.name: completeEdit
items.text:
Called when focus leaves this input field.
Used to postprocess raw values and perform conversion and validation.

items.name: componentLayoutCounter
items.text: The number of component layout calls made on this object.

items.name: constructor
contentPaddingProperty
items.text: The name of the padding property that is used by the layout to manage padding. See Ext.layout.container.Auto#managePadding

items.name: convertPositionSpec
items.text:
By default this method does nothing but return the position spec passed to it. In
rtl mode it is overridden to convert "l" to "r" and vice versa when required.

items.name: defaultBindProperty
items.text: This property is used to determine the property of a bind config that is just the value. For example, if `defaultBindProperty="value"`, then this shorthand bind config: bind: '{name}' Is equivalent to this object form: bind: { value: '{name}' } The defaultBindProperty is set to "value" for form fields and to "store" for grids and trees.

items.name: dirty
items.text: The dirty state of the field.

items.name: errorEl
items.text: The div Element that will contain the component's error message(s). Note that depending on the configured msgTarget, this element may be hidden in favor of some other form of presentation, but will always be present in the DOM for use by assistive technologies.

items.name: eventsSuspended
items.text: Initial suspended call count. Incremented when suspendEvents is called, decremented when resumeEvents is called.

items.name: floating
items.text: The value `true` indicates that this Component is floating.

items.name: floatParent
items.text: **Only present for cfg-floating Components which were inserted as child items of Containers.** There are other similar relationships such as the Ext.button.Button which activates a Ext.button.Button#cfg-menu, or the Ext.menu.Item which activated a Ext.menu.Item#cfg-menu, or the Ext.grid.column.Column which activated the column menu. These differences are abstracted away by the up method. Floating Components that are programmatically Ext.Component#method-render will not have a floatParent property. See cfg-floating and zIndexManager

items.name: focusable
items.text: `true` for interactive Components, `false` for static Components. For Containers, this property reflects interactiveness of the Container itself, not its children. See isFocusable. **Note:** Plain components are static, so not focusable.

items.name: focusEl
items.text:
The component's focusEl.
Available after rendering.

items.name: frameSize
items.text: Indicates the width of any framing elements which were added within the encapsulating element to provide graphical, rounded borders. See the frame config. This property is null if the component is not framed. This is an object containing the frame width in pixels for all four sides of the Component containing the following properties:

items.name: top
items.text: The width of the top framing element in pixels.

items.name: right
items.text: The width of the right framing element in pixels.

items.name: bottom
items.text: The width of the bottom framing element in pixels.

items.name: left
items.text: The width of the left framing element in pixels.

items.name: width
items.text: The total width of the left and right framing elements in pixels.

items.name: height
items.text: The total height of the top and right bottom elements in pixels.

items.name: hasListeners
items.text: This object holds a key for any event that has a listener. The listener may be set directly on the instance, or on its class or a super class (via observe) or on the Ext.app.EventBus. The values of this object are truthy (a non-zero number) and falsy (0 or undefined). They do not represent an exact count of listeners. The value for an event is truthy if the event must be fired and is falsy if there is no need to fire the event. The intended use of this property is to avoid the expense of fireEvent calls when there are no listeners. This can be particularly helpful when one would otherwise have to call fireEvent hundreds or thousands of times. It is used like this: if (this.hasListeners.foo) { this.fireEvent('foo', this, arg1); }

items.name: initFocusable
items.text:
Template method to do any Focusable related initialization that
does not involve event listeners creation.

items.name: initialConfig
items.text: The config object passed to the constructor during Component creation.

items.name: inputEl
items.text: The input Element for this Field. Only available after the field has been rendered.

items.name: isCheckbox
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Checkbox, or subclass thereof.

items.name: isComponent
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Component, or subclass thereof.

items.name: isFieldLabelable
items.text: Flag denoting that this object is labelable as a field. Always true.

items.name: isFormField
items.text: Flag denoting that this component is a Field. Always true.

items.name: isObservable
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Observable, or subclass thereof.

items.name: labelEl
items.text: The label Element for this component. Only available after the component has been rendered.

items.name: maskOnDisable
items.text:
This is an internal flag that you use when creating custom components. By default this is set to `true` which means
that every component gets a mask when it's disabled. Components like FieldContainer, FieldSet, Field, Button, Tab
override this property to `false` since they want to implement custom disable logic.

items.name: msgTargets
items.text:
Map for msg target lookup, if target is not in this map it is assumed
to be an element id

items.name: noWrap
items.text: Tells the layout system that the height can be measured immediately because the width does not need setting.

items.name: originalValue
items.text: The original value of the field as configured in the checked configuration, or as loaded by the last form load operation if the form's Ext.form.Basic#trackResetOnLoad setting is `true`.

items.name: ownerCt
items.text: This Component's owner Ext.container.Container (is set automatically when this Component is added to a Container). *Important.* This is not a universal upwards navigation pointer. It indicates the Container which owns and manages this Component if any. There are other similar relationships such as the Ext.button.Button which activates a Ext.button.Button#cfg-menu, or the Ext.menu.Item which activated a Ext.menu.Item#cfg-menu, or the Ext.grid.column.Column which activated the column menu. These differences are abstracted away by the up method. **Note**: to access items within the Container see itemId.

items.name: prototype
items.text: Allows the addition of properties to all objects of type Object.

items.name: rendered
items.text: Indicates whether or not the component has been rendered.

items.name: scrollFlags
items.text: An object property which provides unified information as to which dimensions are scrollable based upon the scrollable settings (And for *views* of trees and grids, the owning panel's Ext.panel.Table#scroll setting). Note that if you set overflow styles using the style config or Ext.panel.Panel#bodyStyle config, this object does not include that information. Use scrollable if you need to access these flags. This object has the following properties:

items.name: x
items.text:
`true` if this Component is scrollable
horizontally - style setting may be `'auto'` or `'scroll'`.

items.name: y
items.text:
`true` if this Component is scrollable
vertically - style setting may be `'auto'` or `'scroll'`.

items.name: both
items.text:
`true` if this Component is scrollable both
horizontally and vertically.

items.name: overflowX
items.text:
The `overflow-x` style setting, `'auto'`
or `'scroll'` or `''`.

items.name: overflowY
items.text:
The `overflow-y` style setting, `'auto'`
or `'scroll'` or `''`.

items.name: synthetic
items.text: This property is `true` if the component was created internally by the framework and is not explicitly user-defined. This is set for such things as `Splitter` instances managed by border and `box` layouts.

items.name: validRefRe
items.text: Regular expression used for validating reference values.

items.name: zIndexManager
items.text: Only present for Ext.Component#cfg-floating Components after they have been rendered. A reference to the ZIndexManager which is managing this Component's z-index. The Ext.ZIndexManager maintains a stack of floating Component z-indices, and also provides a single modal mask which is insert just beneath the topmost visible modal floating Component. Floating Components may be Ext.Component#toFront or Ext.Component#toBack of the z-index stack. This defaults to the global Ext.WindowManager for floating Components that are programatically Ext.Component#method-render. For Ext.Component#cfg-floating Components that are added to a Container, the ZIndexManager is acquired from the first ancestor Container found that is floating. If no floating ancestor is found, the global Ext.WindowManager is used. See Ext.Component#cfg-floating and zIndexParent

items.name: zIndexParent
items.text: Only present for Ext.Component#cfg-floating Components which were inserted as child items of Containers, and which have a floating Container in their containment ancestry. For Ext.Component#cfg-floating Components which are child items of a Container, the zIndexParent will be a floating ancestor Container which is responsible for the base z-index value of all its floating descendants. It provides a Ext.ZIndexManager which provides z-indexing services for all its descendant floating Components. Floating Components that are programmatically Ext.Component#method-render will not have a zIndexParent property. For example, the dropdown Ext.view.BoundList of a ComboBox which is in a Window will have the Window as its zIndexParent, and will always show above that Window, wherever the Window is placed in the z-index stack. See Ext.Component#cfg-floating and zIndexManager

items.text:
The height of text fields rendered in the context of a grid cell.  Defaults to $form-field-height.  If grid row
height is smaller than $form-field-height, defaults to the grid row height.  Grid row
height is calculated by adding $grid-row-cell-line-height to the top and bottom values of
$grid-cell-inner-padding.
